title: Bug 6009: New class wizard doesn't set correct context for nested classes
description: When using the new class wizard, the 'Enclosing Type' field does not default to the current type in the editor for nested classes.
OB: When clicking the new class button and checking 'Enclosing Type', the field is blank instead of defaulting to the current type in the editor.
EB: When clicking the new class button and checking 'Enclosing Type', the field should default to the current type in the editor for nested classes.
SR:
1. Open a .java file in the editor.
2. Click the new class button.
3. Check the 'Enclosing Type' field.
4. Verify that the field is blank when it should default to the current type in the editor for nested classes.
